title: American F-16 warplane crash lands in German forest
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Click to play Tap to play

Get the biggest daily news stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

An American warplane has crash landed in a German forest.

The aircraft crashed near the western German city of Trier earlier this afternoon.

It has been identified as a F-16 fighter jet belonging to the United States Air Force, a spokesman for the German Air Force said.

The pilot reportedly ejected to safety before the plane smashed to the ground.

It landed between Trier and the U.S. Air Force's Spangdahlem Air Base, reports Bild.

Police said they received calls about the crash at 3.15pm local time.

(Image: Getty)

A large area around the crash site has been closed.

The pilot was rushed to hospital bu is believed to have only suffered minor injuries.

A U.S. air force spokeswoman said the jet had crashed at around 15:00 local time (1300 GMT) during a routine training flight and that there had been no casualties.

Other reports claim a large amount of kerosene has been spilt over the crash site.

We'll be bringing you the very latest updates, pictures and video on this breaking news story.

Please check back regularly for updates on this developing story here at Mirror.co.uk .

description: The F-16 fighter jet crashed near the western German city of Trier earlier this afternoon
